text:
Hello Team, so we are trying to submit our sign up form contact to HubSpot form via API <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/forms/submit_form> Anyone has experience using Ruby?
Some approach could be: get data front the front-end (my example method called "endpointSignUp") and then make call to HubSpot API and pass the data in form-type format (method "call"), then returned result is in JSON.
Anyone know if a <https://zapier.com/apps/HubSpot/integrations#page=28|Zapier trigger> for Custom Objects is on the horizon? Or has anyone created one?

<@UFL9XN2DQ> I don't see why you couldn't just use a basic CURL call from Zapier and do it yourself. Here is a SO from Zapier explaining how to convert a CURL call into a custom request: <https://stackoverflow.com/questions/50789542/converting-a-curl-command-to-run-in-a-zapier-webhook/50804690>
